content.content: Hey gang! I’m curious what changes or additions the community would like to see for makerburn going forward. I’m not promising all suggestions here will be implemented, but I’d love to get a sense of what you all would want to see. So please leave a comment and I’ll consider it!
Historical data! You have some graphs that are nice. Any other historical data in graph or tabular form is hard to get
Hey! Love the site. Maybe MKR auctions as well as collateral auctions? (NB minor typo on the current auctions page: COLLTERAL)
May be not that important, but on the real time auction add the auction price failing and market price as the time. Great work BTW!

Annual earnings per coin. As of this writing, I believe that would be approximately 96.79 DAI/MKR/year (i.e. (87,823,980 DAI annual revenue) / (907,351 MKR outstanding)). I realize this is very similar to P/E ratio, but given our emphasis on burning, I thought EPS might be nice. “If you had one MKR, this is how much it would return per year.” I also like earnings per coin more than P/E ratio because it removes MKR price fluctuations from the equation. Barring large increases in expenses, earnings per coin generally ought to only go up as DAI supply & revenue increase, and as we burn MKR. A chart of earnings per coin over time might be neat, too. Thanks for the site 🙇‍♂️
I came here to say that I love Makerburn.

how much will get liquidated on next oracles-drumbeat - something like Vaults at risk - Maker Risk Dashboard | Block Analitica so i don’t have to open a 2nd tab  PS: loving your site, thank you so much!
Current auction price during a liquidation auction. Thank you for the great dashboard.

Thanks for making the site - it’s almost permanently open in one of my tabs. I would be grateful if vault ID could be displayed on the liquidations page, as well as an all time tab in addition to the month, week, day ones that are already available
Great product. I use it regularly and also as an example of what DeFi can actually do for my coworkers and friends. I would love a chart showing historical P/E over time.
I think we all love it hehe

I’d like to suggest adding Year-over-Year (YoY) & Month-over-Month (MoM) Growth rate next to the P/E ratio, that’ll help put the P/E ratio in good context - because in stock valuation, Maker’s PE is unbelievably cheap given its hyper growth rate. The other alternative is the PEG ratio (P/E to Growth), but I think that’s less intuitive to the common folks. Thanks again for the great work!

This’ll probably read more like a wish list but hey you asked   Filters for fee generating assets vs stablecoins (risk weighted assets) Filters by asset type (if I want to easily filter for all Eth vaults for example, all UNIv2 vaults, Real World Assets, etc) Monthly/quarterly/annual revenue Monthly/quarterly/annual net income (will need to build in expenses which will be a big project, I can help with this) CET1 Ratio (Surplus Buffer as a % of Risk Weighted Assets, all assets that generate stability fees) + chart More data on PSM Fees and Liquidations + charts Burn data (average price all MKR was burned at)
Aes:  Burn data (average price all MKR was burned at)

I have a request, to have a snapshot every month of the total collateral composition and see their rate of change, so for example now that everyone is crying about USDC we can show them that 4 month ago ETH was the dominating Collateral.
Is it possible to summarize the individual transactions on this page? For example, it would be great to see  average price burned at for the current or past month.
Makerburn works just fine. It provides the most accurate information.

Hi @makerburn, I love your site, I visit daily and sometimes it is even constantly on. That being said… ready for a challenge? Your site presently contains the collateral types RWA001 (6s Capital) and RWA002 (New Silver - through Centrifuge). First of all let me tell you this list of Real World Asset collateral types is only going to grow and you might put them on a separate list sooner rather than later. Second, maybe without realizing it you have just created the Coinmarketcap of Real World Assets in crypto. You could keep adding RWAs and then you could maybe add the eventual RWAs of our dear competitors as well. This will likely create some mild irritation and spur action in the community. Edit: can you maybe add what is done with RWAs over at Centrifuge as well? So we have NS-DROP which is the Maker part and then we have the New Silver DROP and TIN info from the Centrifuge site. Adding that info to Makerburn would make it much easier for us to see if something is out of order or mispriced. ok?
I love your website. Is it possible to show when funds are taken from the Surplus buffer to pay core units as it ultimately delays the burner?
Can “ATH” (All Time High) badge be added to mobile version of the website?
dumitru:  added to mobile   Turn your phone sideways and you’ll see it

Some stuff that’s been implementet lately: Filtering for collateral list  filtering943×170 14.3 KB  Current price display on active liquidations  liq-current-price1012×221 16.5 KB  A lot of new collateral parameter changes are logged and shown  liq-param-logs949×285 45.8 KB  Annual profit pop-up is more descriptive  System surplus and buffer limit has been added to the chart  Also, the site back-end has been migrated out of my literal storage room to a dedicated cloud VM and cleaned up/ optimized quite a bit. There might be some minor bugs or errors as a result of this, though I think it’s mostly been weeded out by now.
Is there a specific ATH badge you’re missing? There are several and they should all be visible on mobile (in portrait mode)  What type of phone/OS/browser/resolution are you using?

OK, I found out that ATH badges are visible in landscape mode on mobile. I was looking at the screen in portrait mode. Would be good to see badge no matter what mode is used. My phone is Samsung S20 if that helps.

Would be nice to take a peek at the source on Github. If not, would appreciate if you linked some details about the topics/call data for a burn. I need better time-series granularity and to get the numbers into Excel so will be querying burns in Dune. Would tip for a working example of burns by e.g. week in Dune as it’s pretty urgent.

To get burn data I just read the “Burn” event type from the MKR contract (0x9f8f72aa9304c8b593d555f12ef6589cc3a579a2). const instance = new web3.eth.Contract(mkrTokenContractAbi, contractAdr) const burnEvents = await instance.getPastEvents('Burn', { fromBlock: 0, toBlock: 'latest' })
Download CSV files would be on my ask list!

Default time period in the charts is 1 month. In the list of options 1 month it is visible on computer, but not visible on mobile. Once switched to some other period on mobile, it is not possible to come back and see 1 month chart. Browser brave and mobile phone is Samsung S20. Is it possible to add 1 month to mobile viewport? P.S. Can provide screenshots if needed.
Thanks for the notice! This should be fixed now. You might have to refresh.
Now ‘1 week’ disappeared on mobile.  That’s fine if you say that’s expected. I thought intervals will be the same, no matter what device type is used.

Yes, that was expected. I swapped week and month. In the past I’ve hidden one or more of them due to the limited screen width of certain devices. However, since there is now also abbreviations for the periods (ex. 1 week → 1W on mobile), there is enough room to show all options even on very small screens. So that’s what I’ve done  All options should be visible now!

I think that this hasn’t been mentioned yet - something that struck me as missing from the interface are links to on-chain data, like contract addresses or transaction hashes. Having links to the contracts would be a great resource, for example the different token vaults could have a link to the GemJoin contract, as a dev I’d like to have that information displayed so that I can help people find contracts more easily. Also, it would be nice to get a link to transactions that updated the parameters for different vaults (when looking at the recent vault changes list, for example when someone bumps the debt ceiling on some asset)  Thanks for maintaining makerburn.com  It’s a great, GREAT resource.

Can we, please, add to Collateral list page two extra filters (three dots → checkboxes) for Capped and Maxed collaterals? So that we can filter out these type of collaterals that are currently capped and/or maxed. And, whenever there are capped collaterals,  on the main page banner, when clicking on e.g. " There is currently 1 capped collateral", we would land on Collateral list page with an active filter, where this only capped collateral is shown. Collateral list is currently quite long. And will become even longer in the future. So having this filter would allow to quickly see collaterals with specific statuses. Thank you!

Suggestion for the recent burns page. You could add FLAP auctions that have been finished but not dealt yet. The auctions are effectively done but, there’s no DEAL transaction, so it doesn’t show up on Makerburn. You could also just add all the FLAP auctions, even ones in progress.
Suggestion to add current MKR token supply amount somewhere on the main page. That would make it more obvious and clear why the burn effect is important for the system.
The numbers need to be on fire though. ;D

It would be nice if the burns page showed the time the auction was kicked. The time each auction is dealt is a bit arbitrary, and looking at it doesn’t give as clear of a picture of the cadence of burns.
And while they’re on fire, we’d also like to request some background music, please…

It would be nice if the main Surplus Buffer indicator showed the current value (like the graph does), not just the maximum value. Maybe even a visual indicator showing progress towards eventually getting to (in this case) 90m from 60m over 30 weeks. Could even add a button to update the value.

The surplus buffer countdown already shows all of this.  It’s a bit hard to see right now since the diff of current system surplus to current buffer limit is small compared to the final target, but it’s there. If you click the graphic all of this is spelled out as well. I realize some people are confused about the state of the buffer and burning at the moment, but that honestly seems pretty hard to avoid when the rules of the system changes.

May be higher contrast color to show the temporary limit would help? Or a tooltip text on hover displaying what is written on your picture in red. This is a critical and very sensitive part of the system, and I see many users got confused by the change on your website. It’s good that it is used as a standard to understand Maker Ecosystem, but that means it needs to be crystal clear to avoid confusion and disappointments. And again, thanks a lot for the work you put into makerburn website!

Even though it’s periodically changing, I feel like the headline “SURPLUS BUFFER” (and “days to go”) numbers should be based on what you labeled “temp (lerped) buffer limit”. As it stands now, if I didn’t know better, I would take “30.8M DAI remaining” and “209 days to go” at face value and expect no burning for months, when in actuality there is likely to be some burning within a week or so.

I’m sorry, but I disagree. If the countdown was based on the lerped limit, it’d be a pretty useless graphic constantly showing ~0-1 “days to go” or “buffer full”. The graphic (like its label states) does not show “time left to burn”, it shows an estimate of how much time we will spend accruing system surplus given the current system state. Also, I think just showing the lerped limit would be misleading. Fact is that we will be spending about 30 weeks building surplus and people should be aware of this. The reason some people interprets the graphic right now as “no burning for 209 days” is because the buffer target was raised and burning stopped. We have a history of just completely stopping burn for long periods of time, so it’s not surprising people are quick to jump to this conclusion. Personally, I think it’s really unfortunate that a batch of expenses was pulled at the exact same moment buffer target was raised resulting in a couple of days with no burn. Hopefully, the restarting of partial burn in about a day makes it more clear that we’ll still be burning for the time being.

Hi @makerburn , Thanks for the latest updates. I think they are great! I have a feedback or feature request, whatever you consider it.  On the main page Dai supply total and  MKR price blocks have two side arrows in the top right corner that go to the line graph showing progress over time for corresponding asset. At the same time System surplus, Annual profit estimate and MKR tokens burned so far do not have these arrows. It takes some clicks to find information about progress over time for above three values. Besides that users need to know that there is such data on the website (not everyone is aware). I think, for consistency reasons as well as for easier access to information, would be good to have two side arrows on all of them and link each of them to corresponding graphs. So that:  Dai supply total <-> makerburn.com   System surplus <-> makerburn.com  Annual profit estimate <-> makerburn.com  MKR Price <-> makerburn.com   MKR tokens burned so far <-> makerburn.com  Recent changes <-> makerburn.com
Hi there, Makerburn is great. Is there a way to download CSV file of the data somehow? Would be very helpful. Thanks, Calvin

@makerburn, it’d be great to see MKR liquidity on exchanges. As we burn more, I’ve seen a few people reference “there’s only X MKR left on Coinbase/Uniswap”. It’d be helpful to have a quick reference to that number. Love the site!
There is some data on MKR liquidity already available on the MakerDAO Risk Dashboard
Great, thanks. The slippage history is approximately what I was looking for.

Hi @makerburn I frequent to your site a lot and I love it. Just for fun and totally non-functional related, maybe you can put some fun milestones on the % of MKR already burnt (the website is called makerburn after all). You can refer to ratiogang.com for what I mean .

First, makerburn.com is amazing and getting better all the time! I did notice that Stability Fees under Annual Profit Estimate doesn’t always match the total shown in the Collateral List. Does the value in the Annual Profit Estimate update less frequently? I think it would be nice if it had the latest value, like the Collateral List appears to have. Edit: Nevermind, my mistake. Needed to un-hide collateral with zero debt ceiling. Thanks @Future_of_Finance
Can I request the current and next oracle prices for collaterals? This is the one thing I still use daistats for but I think makerburn can easily add this information in.

The collateral list excludes vaults with debt ceiling set to zero by default, which explains the difference (some of these vaults still generate stability fees). You can turn of this filter by using the button below:  image1242×1312 130 KB

@makerburn Hey thanks for adding the progress bar! I noticed after the mass flap auction today, your site is not showing all the flap auctions. (I am pretty sure there are a few auctions with only 4-5 MKR sold) maybe you want to take a look at that.
You’re right. So many flap auctions came in at once that the process collecting that data failed. It’s fixed now, however: makerburn.com
Since liquidation penalty income is so lumpy, maybe use 12 month trailing instead of 3 month annualized in the Annual Profit Estimate?
Can you please add minimum allowed debt (“dust”) parameters for each collateral?

I don’t suppose there is any chance you can include the human-readable parameter names, and link to the parameter documentation, is there?  We have docs for most of these in the Maker Operational Manual.
That’s my intention. Just have to start somewhere!

I have a suggestion… Link to post like this somehow from makerburn. You already show so many things in the way of PE ratios and so forth (lots of stuff for investors to know). Most investor websites will include links to the quarterly results for review. For instance this website for AAPL has the quarterly results linked right from the frontpage where you can quickly go look at it. I could see makerburn as a place where you could go and find these cataloged and potentially there could be some work done standardize the view with something that you would see in a quarterly earnings pdf.

I just noticed “DAI on L2s” section. Great job! One small piece of feedback is that it lists a lot of things that are not L2s. I would simply name it “DAI on different domains” or “Cross-chain DAI”. PS: maybe this will be helpful: L2BEAT – Frequently Asked Questions
Thanks for the feedback! I like the L2 term, even though it might not be fully accurate, because it’s so recognizable. Actual L2s (rollups) are tagged with an icon to differentiate:

Just wondering if it makes sense to use the same time-frame for protocol expenses and earnings in the following two sections to consistently know whether the protocol is net profitable or not?   Currently, the first one says the surplus buffer is decreasing while the second one says the system surplus growing. I’m guessing this is due to the large oracles payment.

Hey @makerburn thank you so much for such an awesome Maker dashboard. This is the coolest tool I’ve found on the project. I was wondering if you had any plans to enable embedded chart links or an API that 3rd parties could use (I am with Blockworks) to spread these charts to a wider audience while of course giving you credit. I think you’ve done an amazing job and would love to further share your work. Thanks in advance.

Is there a way to download time series data (say, in a csv) of DAI minted and DAI redeemed? Daily data is what i’m looking for, but of course block-by-block (more granular) is fine. Obviously all on chain, but I suspect that this aggregation is already being done to display the charts on makerburn.com…figured i would ask.

First of all, I love this project and I think it’s a very important part of mkr and it’s the first thing that I looked at when I sought to learn about the protocol.  Thank you for the hard work and care put into this. Something I’m always having to do is look at the vesting totals and subtracting out the unclaimed portions of it to understand the true state of the surplus buffer and treasury.  Would it be possible to add some kind of surplus buffer counter that considers the vesting expenses.  I think this would help with understanding the true rate of growth for the surplus buffer rather than the way it slowly rises and then loses a big chunk randomly when some CU claims their income.  I don’t really know what to call it some kind of projected surplus buffer? I think the accrued vesting values should also be used to calculated estimated profit rather than projecting based off actual expenses.  But I get that there are one off expenses that need to be considered.  This could be another category on top of vesting expenses?  I know these are kind of big changes but wondering if others also think it would make sense to do things this way.  I’m mainly looking for more transparency in the actual state of mkr and makerburn is a highly visible part of the protocol.
Is there a way to download some of the data? To track expenses or TVL?
Hey, thank you so much! Apologies for the late reply. No plans for embedded charts at this time, but it’s a cool idea! Public APIs are also interesting. Might do that!
There is no way to export data from the site at this time, but it’s a recurring request, so I might look into it
No worries on the delay, my friend. If you do set up an API and think to follow up that would be great. Cheers and thanks for all your hard work

Thank you for the feedback, I appreciate your suggestions! I always aim keep the site, and especially the dashboard, clean and easy to understand. Adding more data can overload users surprisingly fast, so I try to be conservative and only put up the most relevant stats. And while unclaimed vested DAI is sort of negative surplus, it may also be returned to the buffer. Then there’s also the consideration that processed numbers are harder to independently verify.
Hi @makerburn ! would it be possible to include a link to the latest Financial Report 2022-03 in the expenses section of your site?
For what it’s worth i found a way to easily aggregate data by using Dune. https://dune.com/queries/475738 and https://dune.com/queries/473989.

Just bumping this @makerburn These financial reports are providing insights and it would be awesome to align Makerburn with them a bit more on the charts pages.  an onhover tool tip on fee income annualized (explains the formula maybe) here  Modelling Month Over Month and quarterly rNPI. Deffering to @SebVentures or @adcv for how we could model that out a little better.  As always, thanks for creating such an amazing resource.

I think this is already mostly possible. Speaking with Tim, wondering what the setting is for showing annualized expenses by default? If you show a rolling average by default it’ll correct for month on month cash flow variations. Thank you btw @makerburn for this resource it is literally my home page

Was looking around at the recent 2.9M DAI draw and found all the CU draws from SB here.    makerburn.com    makerburn.com Dashboard for watching DAI minting and MKR token burning in real time.      Brought up a thought for makerburn to create another chart/tab for accounting which is the remaining DAI in CU controlled multisigs called CU DAI on hand.   We hear from SF that CUs have in total about 15M DAI on hand (at last report) and since this is just a total of the DAI still in CU multisig wallets it should be an easy add. So it would be nice to see a chart of this CU DAI on hand over time and to have on the ‘profitability’ a button to add or remove this from the ‘net expense’ total which would ofc also affect bottom line.   I think just seeing a chart of this excess DAI - in aggregate - as well as for each CU would be interesting as well.
This info is already on there (flip your phone over if on mobile):    makerburn.com    makerburn.com Dashboard for watching DAI minting and MKR token burning in real time.       image1211×1254 166 KB

Aaaah.   Now is there a graph of this (both by CU and in aggregate) over time?!  Also I think when it comes to profitability the ability to add this to the revenue calculation (and the ability to control what goes into that in the calculation page as well) on the profitability graph would also be very useful . Since if I take the numbers I am seeing there it doesn’t match at all the DAI expenses listed on the top level.  -47.5M, where as the above page 55.8-16.7  image749×317 19.7 KB   image944×48 1.75 KB  Point here is that a more accurate number is more likely to be that 55.8M-16.7M =39.1M for CU expenses than the 48.1M that is the actual paid as a real expense run.   Also note that 39.1M is a pretty different number than 55.8M or 48.1M and it would significantly adjust the profitability line on the front page. The 48.1M is the Bugdet expenses - Requested by CUs The 39.1M is the actual budget expenses as measured both by Expenses - CU DAI left in multisigs. Which brings up a question how is that expense line defined?  (not clear to me)  Which brings up an additional point to think about.   Putting up definitions for each of the columns that can be clicked on so people can look up how the line items are calculated.  I like to see this info as a link on the text itself that can take the user to the specific entry on a sitewide info/definitions page but your call as to how to handle that. Thanks for the snappy reply btw.    Nice to see the DAI still held by CUs and see that my 35-40M actual run estimate is more realistic than the 48M and growing.

55.8M = Net DAI drawn from the system surplus (47.5M) last 12 months + MKR drawn from the treasury (8.3M, dollarized at time of transfer) last 12 months. 48.1M = Active DAI vests. However, DAI is also drawn directly via executives.
Dune query Reference query

Just want to thank you @makerburn for all the work you put in to make MakerBurn website! It’s rly cool to see everything in real time and it makes Maker feel very much alive as a project. Just wish we were actually burning some Maker

Screenshot_20220728-103052_Chrome1080×725 78 KB  For RWA vaults, would it be possible to add how the Interest Rate (Annual fees) is determined? i.e. fixed or floating. Or a graph that shows the interest rate change over time if you click on the annual fees? So basically for NS-DROP it would show a 3.5% flat line since inception if no rate changes have occurred. @makerburn

Hi @makerburn, I love the site and updates you consistently are making to it. Is there any chance you’d consider adding a projected/estimated yield for the HVB vault on your site in the future? I recognize it’s likely difficult to estimate until we get a better sense of how the loan book is being built, but I think it would be a useful metric for viewers to have access to.
Hey! Yes, this is planned. Just waiting for some returns to come in so I have something to base it on.
I know it’s not on-chain yet, but could we get revenue estimates from the RWAs?
That’s coming as soon as DAI starts turning up in the jars
Will you do an extrapolation based on average you see coming in to the jars?
I will extrapolate on the average amount of outstanding DAI in between payments and the amount coming in

My request is to rename the website. There is no MKR burn and there will never be one again. Its not in the interest of the people controlling the DAO. If I had to guess. The security buffer flows partially into the coffers of Lamborghini and Ferrari. Not creative so not sure what you can name the website. Maybe MakerWatch ? You can market the site for people with low blood pressure. Invest in MKR and follow the page and see your blood pressure go up.

What is the timing on when we will see MakerBurn reflect the new income from RWAs (such as Monetalis) into our annual profits? I would love to swing that nasty $20,000,000 - $35,000,000 loss figure into a positive figure with the help of the RWA’s contributions.

Have you seen my MIP currently under review? It restarts the burn (at a very, very small amount) – and lays the foundation for that to be fully re-engaged. Lots of community support – I believe it will pass! Keep the faith – the burn is coming back!

I didnt sell yet. And yes this is good news. Its just that I lost faith that the people controlling the DAO actually want MKR to appreciate if they find a way to somehow farm the revenue streams directly.

I found a tiny little bug to squash at Makerburn.com If you go to the “protocol expenses” page on an iPhone and press on the chart to see what date is referenced on the chart, it shows up as “invalid date.” Obviously not a critical or even significant bug… but figured I’d share.
If there are several executives scheduled to be executed, it would be good to display countdown time notifications for all of them on the main page.
Is it possible to add a filter and only be able to list active and currently running liquidation auctions?
Would also like to see a filter for on-chain volatile collateral (i.e. everything except stables and RWAs).
@Aes, @dumitru here you go:  image1380×990 60.8 KB
Oops sorry, I meant in the collateral list drop-down.  image935×330 30.9 KB  Appreciate the quick response and implementation!
And here you go:  image1068×1114 116 KB
